Radiation Power and Transfer

Power $\equiv$ Radiant Flux:
<!-- \footnote{Strahlungsleistung, Strahlungsfluss, Energiestrom}
\index{Power}	\index{Flux} -->

$$\begin{split} &
\Phi = 
\frac{d}{dt}W = 
|\frac{1}{\mu_0}(\mathscr{E} \times \mathscr{B} ) | = 
| \mathscr{S} | = 
\oint\limits_A\, \mathscr{S}\, d\vec{A}
\end{split}$${#eq-radiationpower-1}

$dW \equiv$ Radiant Energy\footnote{Strahlungsenergie}, $W \equiv$ Work
<!-- \index{Energy} -->

$\mathscr{S} \equiv$ Poynting-Vector, $A \equiv$ radiant surface area, $d\vec{A} \perp dA$
<!-- index{Poynting-Vector} -->



Flux Density $\equiv$ Radiant Intensity (ray beam angular from source at distance $g$):
<!-- \footnote{Strahlstärke, Flussdichte}
\index{Flux Density} \index{Intensity} -->

$\mathscr{J} = \frac{d\Phi}{d\Omega_g}$

$\mathscr{J}_{\lambda} = \frac{c}{\lambda^2} \mathscr{J}_{\nu}$

$$\begin{split} &
d\mathscr{J} = \frac{d^2\Phi}{d\Omega_g} = 
\frac{d^2\Phi}{ \frac{dA_b \cos(\varepsilon_b)}{R^2} } = 
\mathscr{L} dA_g \cos(\varepsilon_g)
\end{split}$${#eq-radiationpower-2}

where Radiance\footnote{experimentally measured} $\mathscr{L}$ = const.

Irradiance $\equiv$ Impact Intensity (ray beam straight at receiver in distance $b$):
<!-- \footnote{Bestrahlungsstärke}
\index{Irradiance} -->

$\mathscr{I} = \frac{d\Phi}{dA_b} = \mathscr{J} \frac{\cos(\varepsilon_b)}{R^2} = \frac{d\mathscr{H}}{dt}$

Radiant Exposure $\equiv$ Action:
<!-- \footnote{Bestrahlung, Strahlung-Wirkung auf Fläche A}
\index{Radiant Exposure} -->

$\mathscr{H} = \int\limits_{t_1}^{t_2}\, \mathscr{I}(t)\, dt$


Radiant Exitance $\equiv$ Radiant Emittance:\
<!-- footnote{spezifische Ausstrahlung, Leuchtkraft}
\index{Exitance} \index{Emittance} -->

$\mathscr{M} = \frac{d\Phi}{dA_g}$


Radiance $\equiv$ Radiant Density (Apparency, Brightness):
<!-- \footnote{Strahldichte, Helligkeit, prop. Leistung, $\rightarrow$ Strahlungsfeld}
\index{Radiance} \index{Radiant Density} -->

Emissity
<!-- \footnote{Emissionsvermögen}  -->
$\equiv \mathscr{L}_g$ 
<!-- \index{Emissity} -->

Appearence Areas:  $dA_g \cos(\varepsilon_g)$ and $dA_b \cos(\varepsilon_b)$ 
<!-- \index{Appearence} -->

$$\begin{split} &
\mathscr{L} = 
\frac{d\mathscr{J}}{dA_g \cdot \cos(\varepsilon_g)} = 
\frac{1}{dA_g \cos(\varepsilon_g)} \frac{d^2\Phi}{d\Omega_g} = 
\frac{1}{dA_b \cos(\varepsilon_b)} \frac{d^2\Phi}{d\Omega_b} = 
\frac{c}{4\pi} w_{EM} 
\end{split}$${#eq-radiationpower-3}

$\mathscr{L} = const.$: diffused emission, reflection, brightness, rough no mirroring surface
<!-- \footnote{"Lambert's cosine law"}  -->
<!-- \index{Lambert} -->
...

$\mathscr{L} \neq$ const.: radiation transfer, no diffusion, apparent, smooth surface mirroring
...
